intro: Arrabidaea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered arrabidaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in racemes, and the leaves are compound with small, oval leaflets. It is often found in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
